comments:
Before you ask, I did check and made sure that I do NOT have xerces in my ext
directory. I'm running JDK1.5.0_1 and the only thing in my ext directory is
dnsns.jar, localedata.jar, sunjce_provider.jar, and sunpkcs11.jar.

Eclipse 3.1M5a, BIRT 1.0M1, EMF 2.0.1, GEF 3.1M5, VE 1.0.2, Windows XP SP2.

(Note BIRT does have a xerces in one of its plug-ins.)

I tried to open the Error Log view and got an error dialog and a new exception
in the .log file. I'll post a small excerpt here, and attach the full log in
case you need it.

Created an attachment (id=18720)
Log file that I can't open (compressed)
Does this happen if you remove BIRT?

No, if I remove BIRT from my links directory and restart Eclipse then it doesn't
happen.

Passing to core for comment.  UI is only trying to use the default XML
implementation.

This is an issue similar to what is described in bug 87298 comment 9. BIRT
packages its own SAX/DOM parser implementations and a copy of the JAXP API. 

The difference here is that it is causing grief to a completely unrelated
plug-in. How could JAXP from the boot class loader (which I suppose is the one
being seen by Platform/UI) find out about BIRT's implementation (which
implements DocumentBuilderFactory from its own copy of JAXP)? Is the JAR service
provider registry global (maintained by the boot class loader)?

The osgi R4.0 behavior that caused this problem has been implemented but disabled.
See bug 93343 comment #21
